activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11642
activity.text:
Thanks @nihal467 for finding them ðŸ™Œ



> * When we submit a Medication Request, and view the preview in the medication section, the units are visible without 

I reverted this I assumed it is working similar to duration but not, so fixing it will lead to more changes as this PR already has to many changes, I just reverted it out.

> * [ ]  the text area used by the number in duration is different when the units are day and days, where the design is becoming inconsistent.

I fixed it now

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/07a51722-f205-44fb-b317-d76938e22183)


> @yash-learner The newly identified bugs have appeared in the same area where Cypress initially flagged a functionality issue. Since repeated functionality problems are being observed in your UX-related PRs, Request you to perform a thorough self-review of both functionality and design before submitting your PR for review

These tiny issues came after adding translations in the last minute, I should have checked it. ðŸ˜

I will do a full check and then request again, sorry for inconvience @nihal467 


 CC: @amjithtitus09

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care#2911
activity.text:
> [@yash-learner](https://github.com/yash-learner) Hi, could you please say is this a feasible solution? Could I work on it with you if possible?
> 
> * Give superadmins an API endpoint to toggle global_mfa_enforced.(field added to configuration settings or environment variables)
> * Give facility admins an API endpoint to toggle mfa_enforced(added as boolean to Facility model) for their respective facilities.
> * When logging in, check the status of MFA enforcement (both global and facility level).
> * If MFA is enforced and not configured, redirect the user to the MFA setup page.
> 
> Add appropriate UI changes ETA: 2 days

@ByteKnight-SRM 


> could you please say is this a feasible solution?

You just re-wrote the sentences of what I had written in issue description ðŸ˜…

> Could I work on it with you if possible?

I don't think this issue is large enough to collaborate, maybe you can work on the FE issue when we file it.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care#2830
activity.text:
> @yash-learner Are we considering a case where all the backup code are used. So we will have to alert the user to generate new set of codes? ðŸ¤”

Nice catch @DraKen0009 

But practically, I would think this would never or rarely happen. In years I never logged in using a backup code. 

I think instead frontend should redirect user to user settings page whenever user logs in using backup code and prompt them to re-configure TOTP device properly, and this would regenerate the backup codes.

If a user ever continuously logs in using backup code, it indicates something is wrong with their totp device.

and 

A user can re-generate backup codes anytime as long as they are logged in

@vigneshhari what do you think should we handle this case ?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care#2816
activity.text:
After a long debug

I couldn't replicate the above error when running `make migrations` inside a docker container, So I thought it may be because of a version mismatch 

local python - 3.12.0
docker - 3.13.1

So then I upgraded my local python to 3.13.1 and the above error is gone
